revised_title: Flint Implements and the Association with Extinct Animals in Geological Beds
tldr: The author discusses the discovery of flint implements found in association with the remains of extinct animals in geological beds in France and England. These discoveries challenge the belief that humans did not exist until after the latest geological changes and the extinction of large mammals. The author presents evidence from various locations, including Abbeville, Amiens, and Brixham Cave, to support the idea that these tools were made by early humans and were entombed with the remains of extinct animals.
